simpleGame.core

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • simpleGame.core.Board

  • public class Board
extends Object
    Describes the board on which Pawns can move. It is of rectangular shape, and is made of squares. One of the square is a "bonus" square: it allows pawns to be stronger.
    Author:
    Erwan Bousse

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Board(int numberOfPawns, int sizeX, int sizeY)
      Constructs a board, with a number of pawns and a size.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Board

        public Board(int numberOfPawns,
     int sizeX,
     int sizeY)
        Constructs a board, with a number of pawns and a size. The pawns are spread randomly. The bonus square is selected randomly.
        Parameters:
        numberOfPawns - The number of pawns.
        sizeX - The number of squares on the x axis.
        sizeY - The number of squares on the y axis.

      • getSquareContent

        public Pawn getSquareContent(int x,
                    int y)
        Finds the content of a square.
        Parameters:
        x - The x axis value.
        y - The y axis value.
        Returns:
        The pawn found, or null if no pawn.

      • removePawn

        public void removePawn(Pawn pawn)
        Removes a pawn from the board.
        Parameters:
        pawn - The pawn to remove.

        public void addPawn(Pawn pawn)
        Adds a pawn to the board.
        Parameters:

      • isBonusSquare

        public boolean isBonusSquare(int x,
                    int y)
        Decides whether a square is bonus or not.
        Parameters:
        x - The x axis value.
        y - The y axis value.
        Returns:
        True if the square is bonus, false otherwise.

      • numberOfPawns

        public int numberOfPawns()

        Returns:

        Computes the maximum amount of golf that a Pawn has.
        Returns:

        Returns:

      • squareContentSprite

        public char squareContentSprite(int x,
                       int y)
        Computes the char that should be displayed to represent the square or its content.
        Parameters:
        x - The x axis value.
        y - The y axis value.
        Returns:
        # if bonus, . if empty, c if current Pawn, a number for a non-current Pawn

        Computes a String that represents the whole board.
